Reviews.Title: “Small room, limited breakfast, early checkout”
Reviews.Author: NgYM
Reviews.Content: Location: Decent location. A good 15mins walk from Victoria Station. It's actually closer to Pimlico Station. Only several Tube stations away from the attractions. The hotel itself is actually very close to several excellent restaurants - walk up Denbigh St --> Wilton Rd and you'll see several good (but pricey) restaurants. Staff: Professional but they dont really put on friendly faces :S They did, however, offered to store our luggages when we checkout. Room: Clean but very, very, very small! I've never stayed in other London hotels before but the room here is TINY. We dont even have space to lay and open our luggages properly. The toilet is also tiny but clean. Breakfast: Several complaints here. 1. Breakfast time is very limited - 7.30am - 9am only. Therefore the breakfast room is packed and guests rush to finish their breakfast. You always have to queue to get food. 2. The tables are small! 3. The website says "full English open buffet breakfast" but in fact the variety is quite limited. Cant really remember now but they serve beacon, eggs, baked beans, mushrooms, toasts, and cereal only. Plus coffee/tea. Guests queue and the staff behind the counter frantically serve you. It would be better if they have other options like yoghurt/fruits etc. Staffs in the breakfast room are friendly and curteous but everyone seems to be extremely busy and rushed. Maybe if they extend the breakfast time people can be more relaxed and actually enjoy their breakfast! Checkout time is also earlier than expected @ 10.30am. Conclusion: London hotels are extremely expensive and this hotel is one of the (only slightly) cheaper ones, provided you book well in advance. However I still dont think it's value for money given the small room and limited breakfast. I've stayed in Bristol for half the price with a much larger room and a much better breakfast. I dont think this hotel is worthy of the AA 4* rating. It is, however, a 'budget hotel' as stated on the website. So you should book this hotel with that mindset.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesarge24
Reviews.Content: A very nice little hotel close to all of the tourist attractions - Victoria Station, Buckingham Palace, Big Ben, Parliament, Westminster Cathedral. We walked a circle route of everything in well under 3 hours. The room was larger than the reviews indicated and the tv was easy to watch while laying in bed, Bathroom was small but we encountered the same size in other european cities. Things worked out well and I am on the large size. Checkin and checkout went very smoothly and quickly. Staff was very hospitable and tried hard to be helpful. Elevator easily held 2 people and two suitcases. Our room overlooked the main street and was quiet. Room was not hot - a nice temperature. Only negative was the net around the building for repairs. Would definitely stay here again. Very convenient to catch Bus 73 in the morning to head to the St Pancras rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: IanJMold_Wales
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 13th March 2012 with friends. We were visiting the Houses of Parliament and having lunch with MPs organised by a Chamber of Commerce. My friend's PA found this hotel (he was on expenses, rest of us paying for ourselves) and it is very convenient for Westminster and is situated in a pleasant part of Pimlico 5 minutes walk from Pimlico Tube. I booked a double room for single occupation through the hotel's own website and paid £120 inc breakfact and internet access and although it was on the basement floor, the room did have daylight from above. It was clean and comfortable and in good repair, a reasonable size for a central London hotel and with a decent shower and entirely acceptable for a one or two night stay. Breakfast was limited but freshly cooked and entirely edible and staff were friendly and helpful in reception, bar and at breakfast. My friends both had single rooms at the front of the hotel, which were very small and apparently very hot and noisy during the night. They did however pay a lot less at £75 per room via a travel agency, so you get what you pay for as usual. I would come back again if I was working in this part of London, or down for the weekend on the train - it was very easily reached to and from Euston.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: kiarajade
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight prior to coach trip from Victoria Coach Station. Room very small but one double and one single bed squeezed in. French doors with balcony to street. Curtains did not close properly and nets were torn. Small balcony littered with glass and cigarette ends. Bed covers were in poor state of repair with tears. Bathroom was very small, could wash feet in shower tray whilst sitting on loo. Steps up to bathroom quite steep. We had requested an early breakfast as we had an early start at the coach station and was told that only cold cereal and toast would be available as breakfast did not start until 7:30 am. Upon entering the breakfast room we were joined by others who were able to have a full cooked breakfast. Dual standards and will not use this hotel again when travelling via coach station. Felt that location of hotel near to coach station should have been more amenable to travellers making an early start.

Reviews.Title: “The reception staff were miserable and un-courteous. The room itself was tasteless not enough towels provided, if not”
Reviews.Author: theresa h
Reviews.Content: The reception staffs were miserable and rude. The room itself was tasteless not enough towels provided and if not for the cheap fan provided & having to open the windows, we would have roasted to death even for late February. On a plus side the location was ideal, not too far from the bus station. I don't think it was value for money and no I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Oh and another thing, I'm sure they put us in a children's room as not only were they twin beds (when a double was requested) but panda covers if you please. The only good thing about this hotel is the picture of the outside of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: Lee G
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Sidney for short city break. Great central location literally minutes from Pimlico tube station and short distance from Victoria. Variety of restaurants available locally. Room was compact but clean. Main complaints were the noise and heat. We stayed in a room on the basement level so views were limited and had to have the fans on for the majority of the time. This we could have lived with but the noise at night was terrible. Paper thin walls = rubbish nights sleep. Other rooms in the hotel may be alright but if you're offered a basement room (floor -1) then reject it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful.”
Reviews.Author: Adrian02071985
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I've ever stayed. Small double beds, with awful pillows and sheets. No air con just a wurly fan on the ceiling. Heating on full blast and unable to turn down on therostat do had to sleep with the window open. The restaurant staff were rude and sat us at a dirty table only to ask what our problem was when we refused to sit at it. Overall an aged dump with squeaky floor boards a fire alarm that goes off in the middle of the night, rude staff, horrible bathrooms (I would compare to an 80's caravan) no parking, cheap uncomfortable beds. No better than a 2 star. I wouldn't stay here again even if it were free. Staff werent interested in our complaint and didn't even say sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: lozboz14
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed for 4 nights in late January. Didn't start off too well when no receptionist was around to help us check-in! After knocking on the bench and calling, she finally appeared from the backroom. To be honest, I think we disturbed her lunch! Room was small but we expected that. It was very clean and comfortable and we managed very well with the small bathroom. My only negative comment was that the breakfast became very 'groundhog day' - same thing day in day out with no variety. Some fruit and yoghurt wouldn't have gone astray. The waiting staff were very pleasant and our coffee cups were always refilled. All in all, a very pleasant stay for GBP59 per night. Would definitely stay there again at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the sidney”
Reviews.Author: michael b
Reviews.Content: I booked the sidney as it claimed to be five star accommodation. Upon arrival (3 febraury 2012 for 3 nights) reception spoke little English and wanted a £25 deposit. Double room was very small, toilet / shower was a portakabin type strucutre in the room. Could not wash face in small sink and little room for toileteries. Room was not clean, dust in piles in the radiator, capret edges were dirty, remote control was pitted. Breakfast was a shambles open from 7.30 to 9.00 even on a Sunday. Had to queue to get in on a narrow staircase. I have stayed at a number of cheaper hotels in London which are far superior! Good location with bus stop to the city outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bargain”
Reviews.Author: jules99691
Reviews.Content: Incredibly cheap for Central London, just £44 for a single room. Normally, as a single, I get stuffed on price and room ! I had a choice of 3 beds to sleep in. All spotless and enough towels for a small family. Tea and coffee facilities, hair dryer and complimentary toiletries. Staff unfailingly polite. Cooked breakfast thrown in. I made the mistake of booking an EasyHotel before, looked cheap but then had to pay for everything including TV. Honestly can't recommend this place enough.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: sims10_12
Reviews.Content: We spent last weekend at this hotel and after reading some of the reviews on here I can say i was very nervous .. Nothing to worry about , checking in easy ,staff really nice , breakfast great . Location fantastic . Room was on the small size but very comfortable for a weekend sightseeing and seeing a show .although rather hot in there . I would go back and stay again Hope this helps !!!

Reviews.Title: “Room too small”
Reviews.Author: Stuart M
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and modern enough, but far to small, only 12-18 inches around the bed. The Tv can not be seen if laying in bed as on wall just above wardrobe. The bathroom and shower was fine. Breakfast was nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Situated Well-Run Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toro24
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 night stay over a weekend. Bedroom was fine and modern but tiny bathroom...just room for one slim person at time. If you need a bigger one you should specify. The best thing is its location, especially if you arrive on the Gatwick Express. It's a 10 minute walk from Victoria Station, which is also a tube station. Pimlico tube station is a 5 minute walk away. Pimlico itself is a nice area with lots of cafés and restaurants. Try Café Nero for good Italian coffee and pastries (all over London). The hotel can hold your luggage when you check out so we had almost a full day to see more sights. They lock it in a room with a combination lock and give you a ticket...so very safe! Staff are friendly and efficient. The breakfast is only fair...better to go to a Pimlico café like Nero.

Reviews.Title: “does what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Fitty86
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a sight seeing day and night out in london. This hotel is great for seeing buckingham palace, big ben, westminister abbey and the london eye, all walking distance 20-30mins or a couple of tube stops away. the hotel is 5- 10mins away from victoria station. Hotel was friendly with clean rooms. the twin room was small but was to be expected but served us very well for one night. Breakfast was very average.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel Great Location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: hayleylou1974
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for a weekend gettaway myself and husband. Arrived Sunday 22nd January and was greeted at the reception. First impressions freindly and looked clean.We checked in and arrived at our double ensuite room was very surprised, was apprehensive after reading some of the terrible reviews. The room was very spacious clean large double bed and ensuite with shower, clean towels tea/coffee making facilities and wall mounted tv. Breakfast was buffet style full english with a choice of cereals, fruit juices etc service was quick and once again staff couldn.t do enough to help you. We had a great stay in London and would definately recommend this hotel and would book again. If you like chinese food visit china town in leicester square Mr WU all you can eat buffet for a fiver very good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Sidney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FreenMarg
Reviews.Content: Situated behind Victoria Station and near Vauxhall Bridge in Pimlico, this hotel is a great location for those travelling to London. Rooms were small but well looked after, beds were good and so was the breakfast. It even has a bar! Very convenient for watching the fireworks on New Year's Eve - no need to worry about transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base For London Trip”
Reviews.Author: keithy84
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for any trip to London sight-seeing or theatre break. This hotel is in an excellent location for the Victoria Train/Tube stations (about 10mins walk). Pimlico tube station slightly less distance. Resturants about 5 min walk way. The hotel is clean and comfortable, rooms aren't tiny at stated in some other reviews, a decent size for a base in which you sleep. Bathrooms are small but have excellent showers with hot water. Staff are friendly and willing to help. Would recommend this hotel as a good base for any London trip

Reviews.Title: “excellent location.. would stay again”
Reviews.Author: bridgee63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here weekend of the 6th January 2012. The hotel is in an excellent location to the Victoria Tube Station (about 10 min walk). We were attending a show at the Victoria Palace so this was great for us as this was only a 10 min walk also. Also great location for other main attractions in London in walking distance or if that was not an option great for the tube or the 24 hour bus service. Yes the rooms are small and hot but they are clean. Breakfast was an acceptable standard in our view and we only waited for a table for about 2 minutes on both mornings of our stay. We had no issues with rudeness of staff at the hotel, check in and out went with out a hitch. I would recommend this hotel for a budget weekend away in London, we booked through hotel.com so rooms were cheaper than advertised at the hotel. We had no intention of staying in our rooms apart from to sleep so I suppose that's why we found the hotel fine - we came to London to sightsee, catch a show and generally have a lovely weekend away - not a weekend to moan about accomodation that really is not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “the room looks like a cabinet”
Reviews.Author: Alex B
Reviews.Content: the rooms are terribly small, looks like a cabinet from a warship from one of those movies from the WWII. it looks nothing like the photographs they put up, cameras do lie after all. In addition, they should get proper blankets not those antic and thin ones...

Reviews.Title: “An Ok hotel, given London prices”
Reviews.Author: annamtv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine - nice rooms, funny bathrooms with plenty of hot water, good breakfasts. We got a good deal, and, for that price, the hotel was fine - close to a bus line and tube. However, if I had paid a lot of money, I wouldn't have been amused. The hotel is 5 mins walk from Pimlico tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: saturdayedition
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is its location. It's a good base for a short stay in London. It's a 5-10 min walk to Victoria Station, and within walking distance of Westminster, Downing St, Buckingham Palace, etc. The rooms are small but well decorated and had everything in it that we needed. We also found the staff to be a bit rude, something that could definitely be improved on at this hotel. The breakfast was fine, although not a very 'relaxing' experience due to how busy it was, but that was alright with us. Everything you may need, including supermarkets, pharmacies, pubs, and restaurants, is in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been great but failed to deliver.”
Reviews.Author: Maurice555
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sidney Hotel via Booking.com based on its location, price and a series of positive comments about the hotel on the site. Upon arrival the external aspect of the hotel was charming reminiscent of the terraces of London brochures. But largely this was where it ended. Our greeting at the hotel was rude, giving one the feeling that it was all too much and that guests were really not wanted. This was pointed out to staff who subsequently became much friendlier. Many of the staff at the hotel had only a limited command of English creating difficulties in getting even simple requests met. This is a real problem for this hotel and should not occur in London where English is the native language. Our room was clean and well maintained but tiny. Services were basic, no tissues provided, basic towels, no face washers or hand towels, wifi available but at an exorbitant cost. Noise was a factor with a noisy air conditioning unit next door making sleeping difficult. Overall we survived the experience but would think twice before using this hotel again. M & M a mature couple Belair SA

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in a box”
Reviews.Author: Tracie M
Reviews.Content: Very small and very hot rooms. Had to queue for 15 minutes for breakfast which was cold and served buffet style by a non too happy member of staff. Toiletries were not replaced for our second day. The stairs were full of dust and quite frankly for the cost of the room, I expected better. Would certainly not stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone I know. Better hotels around London for less money.

Reviews.Title: “"Compact"”
Reviews.Author: Anna56
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my Mum after seeing a show. We checked in reasonably fuss free, there was a problem with our key cards and this was sorted out no problem. The room itself - well its compact if i'm being kind. Its not a good sign when the door won't open far enough to let you walk in with a bag on your shoulder. It was fairly well equipped and comfortable enough. The bathroom was similar. Tiny but there was everything that you needed - expect a bit of space to move. The decor is a bit outdated and the place has the feel of being in need of a lick of paint and some tlc. For our one night stay it was fine, but i certainly wouldn't have wanted to be here any longer than that. The road outside is fairly quiet so there were absolutely no problems with traffic noise. The room was actually very warm so i had the window open for a bit through the night and even then we weren't troubled with road noise. Breakfast was absolutely fine. Tea and toast flowed freely and there's a cooked breakfast that is served from a buffet along with cereals and yoghurts etc. I was lucky to arrive at the buffet just as a new batch of bacon and eggs was being brought out. I wouldn't have fancied the bits that had been sitting there a while. I also think we managed to be quite lucky with our timings. There is seating for a fair few people, but as we left there was a queue about 20 deep waiting for tables. Check out was dealt with in less than 30 seconds and we were on our way. Not an unpleasant stay but i don't think i'll be back again in a rush. For the price you pay for the room, in my opinion, there's better options in more central parts of London.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: shaz72
Reviews.Content: A hotel in a fantastic location with a bus stop out the front and Victoria and Pimlico train staions just a short walk away. Conditions for long haul overseas visitors may be a liitle cramped due to the amount of luggage we carry. At breakfast time, the ethnic staff were a bit stingy with there portion control ( 1 piece of bacon ) reminiscent of post WW2 rationing in Britain.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we payed for”
Reviews.Author: yuio p
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Sidney for a couple of nights in October. We got a triple room, seemed big enough to us, but was very warm & ceiling fan was noisy. Our room was right next to the lift but we heard no noise from it. Toilet/shower was a weird plastic pod thing, but clean & usable, although small. Bed covers seemed a little faded but room was very clean. Breakfast was fine, staff seemed nice. Building is covered in scaffolding as is much of London just now, preparation for the Olympic Games no doubt (funny how we can still afford that). We didn't pay much for the room so we’re very happy over all, we got what we payed for.

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of 4*”
Reviews.Author: Nikki00280
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a package trip to see Wicked the musical for my birthday. Our package included train tickets,theatre tickets and hotel, and the price was very good. HOWEVER, I can see why. The room was tiny (and considering i am only 5ft 3, for me to think its tiny is saying something), We rang ahead to ask for a twin room and were assured we would have one, only to find us both crammed in a tiny double room, with barely enough room to walk around the bed.When i went and asked about this, the incredibly rude receptionist denied any knowledge of my asking for a twin and was i basically told tough! The bathroom was equally small, and the view from the window was a brick wall, making the whole room seem dingy. Luckily, we were just there for the one night,and really only used it to sleep in. The good points are it was clean and within easy walking distance of the theatre, but i would not stay here again or reccommend it to others as i am sure there are better hotels just as close to the theatre. (On a side note,Wicked was AMAZING and i cant reccommend it enough, BRILLIANT show)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - if you're a dwarf.”
Reviews.Author: andrew w
Reviews.Content: The hotel is staffed by mostly European who have english as a second language. So if you're at breakfast and they ask you for 'coffee or tea' and you say 'tea' they think you said 'Si' and you get coffee. Which is abit of a shock. But i've jumped ahead. The hotel currently 28th September has a face full of scaffolding. It's stuffy and the room's air-conditioning is a ceiling fan or a heater. I arrived yesterday at 10am after a 24 international flight and had to wait an hour before my room was ready. The room is so small i couldn't get my suitcase around the first single bed to put it on the second single bed. there is no fridge (unless it's tucked away somewhere) and the tv takes about 5 mins to get to any normal television. However the bathroom is clean, don't expect to share it with anyone though. My travel agent suggested the Hotel Sidney because he said it was close to the airport. Which it is. and it is the heart of London. However, I'm a UK a citizen and he's dropped me right in the middle of tourist central. I'm up the road from Buckingham Palace and well I'm not a tourist. To be honest I could have been a little mean to Sidney Hotel, there are a dozen other hotels that look exactly the same and they are all on this street. All with exotic names all in a row. All catering for the tourists. The downstairs breakfast was ok. The coffee as nice as any hotel coffee. So as I sat with strangers around me I couldn't help thinking what a lovely big old house this would have been. Now it's been converted into a cramped hotel. There was only one baby seat available so the second mum who came down had to have a baby on her lap. The food was dished out to me instead of me having options. Kind of like dinner ladies, so a single sausage was given. In what universe does a grown man only have one sausage for breakfast? There was no water to drink only big jugs of milk on the table. The continental breakfast consisted of cornflakes, or rice, muslie, crispies incase you wanted a healthier start to the day! oh and juices were I think apple and orange. But the hotel did it's duty and for that I am greatful. I was here to get a roof over my head after the flight and some food in my belly the next day. Now my real holiday begins.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chrissy006
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times and it's always excellent-nice restaurants near and a bus outside to take you to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel to go to theatre in Victoria as a birthday treat! Definitely not 4* even by London hotel standards. Merely budget which we were not looking for. The room was tiny. Although it looked like the bathroom was refurbished and was clean, it was only suitable for slim people! The bedspread was dirty! And blankets on the bed- do people still use them? Breakfast was awful! Reception staff were polite. The dining staff were sullen and unhelpful. If this hotel had been advertised as budget and much cheaper It would have been ok for an overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and central”
Reviews.Author: Samantha G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and larger than it looks online. We stayed in a triple room in the basement (it was cooler at least) the only downside to the room was the elevator , you heard it every time!! The breakfast was horrible. We only went down for it on the first day and my pregnant sister (who was in full morning sickness mode) asked for a glass of milk, when they brought it to her it was warm and smelled, safe enough to say we were out of there ASAP and never looked back. We just went to Sainsbury's every night and bought some non perishables to have a quick munch on. If you're going to get a taxi to the airport as we did ask them to book a black cab as we got duped with a private car hire company and paid a FORTUNE! they even charged us more than was on the brochure in his car. The hotel is very central for Victoria etc so it's bad points are redeemed there but there are many other hotel just as close...

Reviews.Title: “We had major problems with this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GraceLovisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our 50th wedding anniversary trip. A trip to Scotland and then London. Three days into our trip I fell and pulled a hamstring and could not walk. We had to cancel the rest of our trip which would have been 2 weeks. We called the Sidney Hotel and cancelled giving them 4 days in which to rebook the room. We also got home and emailed them still giving them 3 days. We were to stay there for 5 days. Having booked it online as we are in the states, we had to pay upfront. They would not refund any of our money. We even contacted our card company but the hotel said it was their policy not to refund period. Do think this is a hotel that does not really care about customers. When we rebook this trip, we will definitely not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: shaneflinteagle
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a breeze. Good bar. Comfortable walkng distance to Victoria Station. Bus to Camden out the front. Room was clean and comfortable. Excellent shower, with glass panels/door not a sticky shower curtain. Breakfast could have gone an extra 30 minutes, it became quite a bun fight if you wanted to have a late breakfast e.g. 0830-0900. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean”
Reviews.Author: NkPrsns
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a nice location in pimlico, well placed for pimlico tube station or Victoria central station and the Apollo Victoria. The room was basic but very clean. We had to queue for breakfast, but when we got in there were lots of spare tables, just not enough staff to clear them. Staff were friendly .This was part of a theatre package and was good value .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: lindargtravel
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location and price. The rooms are small and show heavy wear. If you are planning to spend long hours in the room, spend more money and stay elsewhere. If you're looking for a place to sleep between long days exploring London, a place convenient to public transportation, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “great wee hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kay_SScotland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 day trip to London and ended up back here (stayed here about 4/5 years back but have been to other hotels since. Much better now staff were all helpful and approachable. rooms were clean and comfy, all the usual stuff, tea making facilities (always a must for a tea addict like myself) and toiletries etc. It's a reasonably priced hotel and well worth it I reckon, happy to look after our luggage on check out too with no charge

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel-very handy for tourists”
Reviews.Author: ian_wil
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel to base yourself in then this could be the one for you, but be warned, it's not the kind of hotel where you would want to spend a lot of time - the rooms are really small and the bathroom is about the same size as the ones on a plane! the breakfast room is also small so be sure to go down early to get a table. the hotel's main plus point is the closeness to Victoria Station, Pimlico underground station and the 24 bus which runs 24 hrs a day and stops right outside the hotel. all in all a good tourist hotel in a reasonably quiet part of London while still being within easy reach of the main attractions and theatres.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: arianatravel
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small but clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good although lacks variety and is the same very day. There is a bar and a lounge, which is nice. The elevator is a big plus. WiFi is not free. The neighborhood is not much. The tube is close although the Pimloco Line doesn't always work. It is OK for the price. Elena from Colorado

Reviews.Title: “the tiniest room i ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: skiffo
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice when you enter and the location is great......... when we arrived the receptionist greeted us and told us to take a seat as he was serving another customer and he would give us a shout when ready, half hour later we are still waiting in an EMPTY reception waiting to check in!!!!!!!! not impressed. we get up to our room, open the door and dear god everything is pretty much shoe horned into a room smaller than a box room, it is the tiniest space ever and if there was a fire, well god help us because you have to shuffle past the beds and around the room. absolutely ridiculous. the bathroom....................... or should we say the tiny plastic room where you honestly have no room to turnaround, if you are claustrophobic stay somewhere else. to top it all off the bathroom stunk of urine. not very pleasant at all.

Reviews.Title: “A very convenient budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duncan014
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel which caters for Bed and Breakfast. It is very convenient. The 24 bus which goes to central London stops at the door.Victoria and Pimlico Underground Stations are within easy walking distance The breakfast is good, the rooms are clean and there is a pleasant small bar. Excellent for a short break. Staff are pleasant and helpful

Reviews.Title: “3rd Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Blistersonmefeet Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Sydney Hotel and on each occasion the hotel has met our expectations. Hotel is ideally situated, near all sights and attractions. There has been a much needed upgrade on the bathrooms. Rooms are clean and spacious, with all necessary amenities. Staff are very friendly, especially those in the restaurant, and lovely breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: shawror
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the bottom floor, there was nothing wrong with the room that we stayed in, which was a triple. We used the room to get ready and sleep, so it suited us for that. As for the staff, I was so disappointed on the desk they were rude. We got drinks at the bar (if you could call it that) the desk staff cover the bar. The member of staff made a mistake with a drink that I ordered as she picked up the wrong bottle and I was still expected to pay for it, which I thought was bad service when it was clearly her mistake. It was fairly easy to get a cab anywhere and there is a bus stop directly outside the hotel. it's also just a short walk from Victoria station.

Reviews.Title: “great find, budget hotel. Small but adequate”
Reviews.Author: j_uk_02
Reviews.Content: For the price, this hotel seems to be the best around. I searched for hours to find something well rated for the price of about £60 within a short taxi drive of the Albert Hall. Only problem being a miserable man on reception at one point. Breakfast was average. Room was small, but very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, poor standard compared to rest of Europe”
Reviews.Author: vcampisi
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to find our booking, made 4 months earlier, was cancelled. Staff not helpful, and rather rude. After 5 weeks of travelling across Europe, where every hotel (averaging AU$130 per night) was great, this was a really disappointing end to our stay. The Sidney charged us AU$215 per night and it was a total rip off. Noisy, poor breakfast, and the bed spreads were really dirty (blood stains). Do not stay here unless you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Decent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deak
Reviews.Content: I said here for two nights in the summer of 2010 and had a pleasant stay. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Tube and is fairly central. The room was tiny and cramped, but the standard of the finish was decent. If you are a larger person, have a lot of luggage, or have a long stay then this is not the hotel for you. For an overnight, it's perfect. The food was acceptable, I've definitely had worse.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mylakehouse
Reviews.Content: Very handy for the tube .bus.train from Victoria. Nothing was to much trouble. rooms great. info for visitors good. decline the £25 deposit they seem to ask for and is no problem If I went to London again this is where I would lay my hat Great

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: helsbels82Cardiff
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great, about 10-15 minute walk from Victoria station. The rooms were very clean and the staff very helpful. The breakfast was well organised, with plenty to eat, although the tea could have been better quality. The shower was also great better than my one at home and the bathroom spacious. The only downsides were, our room was next to a storage cupboard so there was a few slamming doors in the morning when they started cleaning 6ish, and also the lighting could be better for make up application.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Sue054
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst stays I have had in a London Hotel. I was with my daughter and we went for Christmas shopping and Markets. The Hotel is in a good location with buses and tube nearby. That is the end of good points. The twin room was cold and drafty. The "bathroom" was a plastic pod in the corner of the room. It was adequate as long as you were not too big a person! Breakfast was too restricted a time-slot. There was very small choice of cereal, foul juice, basic cooked food choice (quantities were limited per person), queues to toast bread, and not much chance of catching staff for a cup of tea/coffee. Because serving time was quite short we found the room overcrowded and visitors were encouraged not to dawdle over their food. Reception staff were not very helpful (unable to check train delays as couldn't find our operator's website) and rather lacking in command of English. When I later complained I received a standard letter basically saying I made claims that were "very unlikely". Would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone that I like.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: madkat21
Reviews.Content: nice hotel close to pimlico underground room clean and bed comfortable,I managed to sleep well which is unusual. nice places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “awful dirty room, caravan style bathroom,stingy food portions.”
Reviews.Author: Bertie021
Reviews.Content: room tiny and dirty. Bathroom same but felt like a caravan(plastic pod insert). Only allowed 2 pieces of bacon even though I did not have any other food at breakfast. Had to ask for a 2nd cup of tea. Staff uncommunicative and no welcome or atmosphere. Definitely not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “OK; with a bit of customer care could be very good”
Reviews.Author: allesca
Reviews.Content: I always stay in Pimlico when I visit London, had always thought the Sidney looked good so was very pleased to get a special rate for 4 nights in their January offer. The single room was average in terms of size. Shower room relatively new and well equipped but must have been fitted by a giant as anyone under 5'8" could not reach the towel rail or the shower head to adjust it: a little forethought and attention to detail here would have avoided this! Overall, I did not get the feeling that guests are at the top of the hotel's list of priorities. It is universal at check-in that hotels take a credit card imprint for incidental charges but at the Sidney they ask for a £25 deposit, thus implying that the guest is preparing to do a runner, and if you ask them to use your credit card, the amount is tied up for 7 days. A strange practice. And although there is a reasonably good buffet at breakfast, there is someone serving it and I did not appreciate the dirty look when I asked for a second rasher of bacon: is it rationed? I wasn't having egg, beans or mushrooms and really didn't think 2 pieces of bacon and a sausage was an excessive amount of food. On the plus side, there were lots of people serving and clearing tables, so service was quick, but a smile never goes amiss and I'm sure a bit more effort to sit groups of 4 or 6 together would be appreciated rather than just telling people they had to sit at whatever table happened to be available first. Not everyone visiting London has the language skills to deal with this. In summary it's not a bad place but you will get a warmer welcome and better service in lots of other neighbouring hotels. More focus on the guests and less on admin and accounting please!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a budget hotel, this is a decent option”
Reviews.Author: mbalass
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all for a solo traveller on a budget, compared to the B&B I stayed at last time I came to London. I think I paid around $75 per night to stay for two nights. The room I had was small but tidy, with two twin sized beds, and a decent sized flat screen TV. I really wanted a private bathroom, so that is what sold me on this place. The bathroom is quite small and the shower was a little bit hard to fit into, if you are a larger size I can imagine it might be kind of uncomfortable. The hotel staff were pleasant enough. The breakfast was pretty good, and the internet connection wasn't bad. The lighting in the room wasn't good. The location is good, a short walk to Victoria station and tourist attractions. There are some decent restaurants in the area. Again if you are looking for a decent B&B and to save some cash, this is a good choice, especially for a solo traveler. For couples or families...probably not judging by the size of my room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieChook
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my mother in mid November. It was about a ten minute walk from Victoria Station/Tube (or less if you're a fast walker) and the same from Pimlico Tube station too. The street also was on a bus run but closer to Victoria Station you'd have even more selection of buses. The hotel has recently been refurbished and the rooms were small, chic and extremely clean. No airconditioning but a small fan was on the desk. The single beds were not narrow and there was enough room for two people to move around (but not much room!). There were tea/coffee making facilities and wardrobe space and a flat-screen tv with pay tv channels and free to air tv. The shower/toilet area was modern, extremely clean, not a sign of mould or dirt, with basic toiletries included. There was no noise from the road even though we had the window open. The heating was very efficient and I'd have liked to have been able to turn it down somewhat but... better warm than cold! There is a lift in this hotel, sufficient for 4 - 6 people, a small and cosy bar on the ground floor and very helpful staff at reception who pointed us in the right direction for buses to the Imperial War Museum (well worth the visit). The breakfast restaurant served full English breakfasts, including eggs, bacon, baked beans and sausages. There were also cereals, fruit jiuces and toast to add to the breakfast all of which was fresh and tasty. There was also internet access downstairs however I don't know if there was a charge for it. This is a very popular hotel - book early. I'd thoroughly recommend the hotel to anyone wanting an excellent budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: missyalli
Reviews.Content: Was taken to London for a surprise birthday trip by my boyfriend and we stayed at this hotel. It is in a brilliant location, we were going to the theatre to see Wicked and it was within easy walking distance, loads of restaurants nearby, on a nice well lit safe road for walking home late. The rooms aren't huge but who needs a large room in London? All we needed it for was sleep. I loved the compact little bathroom, it was very very clean which is all I ask for from a hotel. Am planning a return trip to London and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The photos on the website look ok but don't be fooled... very budget hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: amandaw1976
Reviews.Content: The Sidney hotel location on Belgrave Road is excellent for touring around London, Bus no. 24 stops directly outside the hotel and takes you to central London with no hassle whatsoever.. the hotel is clean but the rooms are extremely tiny, The bedrooms are tired and need a good decorate... the bathrooms are tiny and like an aircraft bathroom. We stayed for a weekend break but got next to no sleep as it was extremely noisy from the traffic!! Breakfast was chaos, it was served from 7-9pm (far too early for a weekend) but if you left it til 8.30am, the queues were horrendous and there were no seats to sit together with your party!!! We won't be staying here again and I wouldn't recommend it to others unless you want a very budget stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: groovybridie
Reviews.Content: we stayed for a 5 night break.The hotel was very clean,bed comfy, 9am finish for breakfast is way too early for holidays... invest in trolly's for accommodation staff .they had linen all over the corridor and we either walked or jumped over it.... bathrooms on the small side (glad i'm not big ) staff helpful but could talk to guests a bit more.. no one says hello, well that was before we met george"! he was brilliant , hotel in good location / near victoria station and bus stops outside door to take you to city center ..would stay again but not in basement, too dark and gloomy ..didn't know night from day...call me old fashioned but i like to see day light during "the day",,

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynchy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sidney Hotel, Victoria, London on a four day leisure trip. Nicely decorated hotel and very clean. Breakfast was lovely. There was the No 24 bus right outside the hotel which came every 10 mins and took you to main centre of London.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for the money!”
Reviews.Author: SummerLeigh01
Reviews.Content: I know my review is late, unfortunately I thought I had already wrote one. After looking online for a place to stay near Victoria station, this one came up a few times on different pages, so I thought I would ring the hotel direct for their best deal. We got a triple en-suite room 1 double 1 single bed. The room was spotless, as was the bathroom, there was little packages of toiletries in the bathroom and 3 towels, which were changed every morning. Reception staff were great nothing was any bother to them when asking for directions or places to eat, the barman was very sociable. The queue for breakfast was a bit of a let down, but once we were seated breakfast was great, there was no problem asking for scrambled egg for the little one, maybe a change from beans every morning (as our little one likes spaghetti or tomatoes). For the price we paid which was £70.00 per night, we would expect to pay over £100.00 per night for what we got, and would of willingly paid it. All in all a great hotel, would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “Internet Special- Amazing Value!”
Reviews.Author: Canada2see
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located within walking distance from Victoria Station. The room was clean and a good size. The breakfast was very good and offered a good selection of food (bacon, eggs, toast, juice, beans, sausages and cereal). The desk staff was very helpful and informative. If you want to be centrally located and you don't want to pay an arm and a leg for a hotel.....you might want to consider this one. I would defintitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here, nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kozoo
Reviews.Content: We got a nice deal here from skoosh.com at $373 usd for 3 nights stay, much better than seen on their website. I was prepared for the worst room in the hotel at this price. This hotel is located on a street totally lined with similarly styled hotels for up to 4-6 blocks. Seems like a decent enough area with a few pub/restaurants scattered about. 10 mins walk to mall/bus/train/underground station (Victoria station) made this location ideal. Pleasantly surprised on early arrival that they'd check us in. They first gave us a room directly behind the reception area desk, very small, dark, cave-like. After initial inspection, it was fine because we were not in London for the room, but inquired if there were other rooms available just to check. The front desk girl was very pleasant and set us up in a different room on the 2nd floor that was a little larger, but with no access to an elevator (no big deal). Rooms were very nicely appointed with comfy bed, flat screen tv, modern decor. Bathroom was like a airplane, very small, but not as small as another hotel's that our friends were staying in, so that seems the norm for hotels priced in this catagory. Breakfast was included, served from 7-9am. We got there a 9:03 and the door was locked. They saw us and let us in, although they seemed quite pissed. The meal was fine, eggs, sausages, beans, toast, etc. Actually, more food than I expected, although my wife had a serious stomach ache afterwards. They did have a nice little bar set up in the reception area (I never saw anyone in there). They had multiple beers on tap and many more options in fridge. I wish i had that set up in my house.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: sanjoOffaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was central if a little hard to find. We booked a twin room but had to settle for a double. The rooms were tiny barely the size of a single. Breakfast was a farce with two lines to the dining room, one from upstairs and one from downstairs, all converging at the same time. only an hour and half for breakfast, not enough time to cater for 42 rooms. Bar was poorly staffed with the male receptionist double jobbing and he hadn't a clue....I felt reception staff were not very friendly, and quite rude when we complained about the room being double not a twin.

Reviews.Title: “Bed-Bugs and Big Queues for Breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget_Guernsey
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at the Sidney Hotel before and I won't be going back. Our room was in the basement and smelled of damp and was dark and dingy, with peeling paint on the wall by the window. Also the bus stop was directly outside our window, so every night we were kept awake until very late by people talking at the bus-stop right outside our window, which didn't close properly either, making the noise even worse. The worst bit however was waking up in the morning and realising that all three of us were covered in tiny red bites. Yuck!!! Absolutely disgusting. Finally, breakfast is chaos. People from the downstairs and upstairs rooms converge grumpily in the tiny corridor outside the dining room, with everyone pushing and shoving and vying to stop others pushing in front. Eventually a grumpy waitress demands to know what room you are in and takes you into the minute breakfast room and then you sit there for 20 minutes before somebody bothers to bring you a cup of ghastly undrinkable dishwater (I think they called it tea). My advice: Spend a few more quid and stay elsewhere (that's what I'll be doing in future).

Reviews.Title: “For My First Time In London Not Bad!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul4As
Reviews.Content: Location was why I chose the hotel...10 minute walk from Victoria Station and Victoria Apollo where I went to see the musical "Wicked". Arrived at about 12:30pm...we were allowed to leave our cases in our rooms despite them not being ready. Lady on reception was not overly pleasant, but efficient enough to do her job. If you don't have a credit card (I only have a debit card) then be prepared to pay a returnable deposit of £25 on check-in. Rooms we got were 211 and 215. Very well decorated rooms...looks like they have been refurbished quite recently!!! They were tiny...BUT when you book a basic hotel like this you shouldn't intend to spend much time in your room...otherwise book The Ritz!!! We were wondering why they had a fan on the ceiling....then we discovered at night-time...the room was sweltering....like being in the Costa Del Sol or Algarve!!! THey really do need aircon!!! Noise -wise...our room was facing the front of the hotel...from 7am onwards there seemed to be quite a lot of traffic noise...even though there wasn't that much traffic!!! Maybe it was because we had to keep the window open because of the heat!!! Breakfast wasn't that stressful an experience...no queues...although we did stay midweek!!! You are warned to expect delays from 8:30am onwards...and are told to take necessary steps...why do they only do breakfast up to 9am??? Surely stretching it to 10am isn't that costly!!! My only gripe with the breakfast was waiting for toast...they cook it fresh, but they only seem to toast 8 slices in the kitchen at a time...no sooner are they put out in the basket they are gone!!! I would return here for the location and cleanliness!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: tribalimpact
Reviews.Content: Rooms are VERY small - we asked to be moved because there was no floor space to stand our suitcases, let alone open them! Breakfast basic and big queues (one-in/one-out system so get there early). The lift doors were dangerous - could crush someone so take the stairs as it's safer. Staff were okay. Worth £129? Not a chance - try the Dolphin Apartments a little further down the road where my parents were staying - MUCH BETTER VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rask46
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, close to Victoria station. We were 9 persons on a 3 days trip to London, and the hotel was quite close to the main attractions. However the hotel itself was a bit disapointing. The rooms were very very small and storing luggage was a problem. Bed were really hard and small, and only one blanket in the "double" bed. Breakfast was advertised as "Full english breakfast"...wich was exaggerated, and there was 15 minutes queue every morning outside the breakfast room, so we couldn´t eat breakfast together, but at different tables.

Reviews.Title: “Really Clean and Modern - Brilliant for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Busymumof2-lib
Reviews.Content: My Husband booked this hotel in a package for a theatre trip for us. We looked at their website and thought it looked nice. We looked at some of the reviews on this site and were a little worried as some people had said rooms very very small, uncomfortable bed etc. However, on arrival to the hotel, the lobby area is really nice, marble effect floor, very clean. Our room was not massive and was fairly small, but it was modern and had lots of storage for clothes (if needed) and had a modern bathroom, with shower cubicle. The main thing for me was that it was very clean and the bedlinen was lovely and white. The breakfast in the morning was a choice of cereals, and cooked full english, which was included in the price. There was also fresh juice and tea and coffee available. It was good. All in all I would stay here again, it was in a good location and only a 10 min walk to and from Victoria Station. I think that it is more of a hotel for short stays as, the rooms are quite small, we only stayed one night, not sure if I would have wanted to have stayed for a week (but only due to size of room).

Reviews.Title: “Certainly compact but definitely not bijou..........”
Reviews.Author: Jesadeke
Reviews.Content: To begin on a positive note, the staff at The Sidney Hotel were friendly and it was clean. However, in my opinion, it should not be classed as 4* guest accommodation; if AA standards are adhered to I would suggest it warrants 3* - at best. Our room was room 307 (and I note with my keen eye for detail that another review was written about this room in Feb 2010 – I wish I had read that before I booked!) which is at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor. I appreciate rooms in London tend to be on the smallish side but this supposedly double room was incredibly tiny, with only a four foot bed (certainly not a standard sized double as advertised on their website). Do not be fooled by the photos on the internet; it’s amazing what a wide-angled lens can do! With it being such a hot evening and the room being so small, we had the window open, which was far better alternative than switching on the enormous fan provided; I was worried it would ‘rattle’ off the wall let alone wake everyone else in the vicinity. It was incredibly noisy throughout the whole night outside and in, as you have to endure the constant banging of doors and sounds of other guests talking and moving around either side and above you and consequently sleeping was nigh on impossible. The en-suite was tiny but adequate, with the toilet being a little too close to the bed for my liking, even if there was a frosted glass door there. I had to sit sideways on the toilet to prevent my knees from touching to door. This room would not be acceptable for a stay of more than one night and would definitely not suit a ‘larger’ couple. The breakfast was only just satisfactory, with cereal, toast and a cooked breakfast, which was strictly rationed, but the watered down orange juice was just awful. We decided to just have the cereal but what we saw other guests eating (easy to do as the tables were so close together), looked fairly average – with lots of beans! We had chosen to get up early, a decision we were pleased about when we left and saw the very long queue of guests winding up the stairs, waiting for their breakfast. For us, this was a one night theatre break we booked through a website offering a very good show and stay deal: fabulous show – just a shame about the stay!

Reviews.Title: “very basic”
Reviews.Author: rklac
Reviews.Content: great location (pimlico/victoria), but small room, tiny bathroom, internet 2.5 GBP/h, queuing for breakfast, sometimes no shampoo, unfriendly nightguard (Mr. Omar).

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: advtracing
Reviews.Content: nice hotel , well placed to get the victoria station area. the rooms are clean tidy but the beds are hard and bony... the noise from the raod outside can be a nunsince with garbage trucks and pub goers late at night. the breakfast is great and plenty of it . i would stay again if in the area. one downer is the in room tv system which they send info to you (wanted or not ) last migh after a 14hour travel day all i was after is some sleep when i got woken up by the tv anouncment at 8.30pm !!!! guys think first before sending stuff out when people have had long flights....

Reviews.Title: “trip to London”
Reviews.Author: alicjaDublin Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Easy acces to air port and underground. But the room was very very small. If you want to stay in this hotel you have to add extra 10-15 minutes to yours brekafast, you have to wait in line for free table. Apart that hotel is clean and staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prevessin
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel long before the trip. I planned to go with my family and my parents, hence I booked 2 triple rooms. However due to volcanic Iceland erupted, just 2 days before we went to London, I had to cancel my booking. They still charged me for the two rooms, reasoning I canceled less then 7 days policy. If I knew the volcanic ash would destroy our vacation to UK seven days earlier I would have canceled it, no ? I canceled 2 days before and still they charged me. I would never book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice area, ggod breakfast, but small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: DorsetHelena
Reviews.Content: We were at the Sidney Hotel on a 2 night London Theatre break, and we thought it was a great location, really easy to get to the West End, a bus stop right outside the hotel, and an easy walk from Victoria station. There is also a good selection of pubs and restaurants within 5 minutes walk of the hotel - Pimlico seems a nice area, quite trendy, lots of hotels, but still keeping some key elements of a residential area, small "locals" pubs and corner cafes etc. The hotel itself was adequate, but beware....the size of the double room we were given was shockingly small....it felt like a bedroom in a caravan, and the bed was a small double, which is a shock when you are substantially-built couple and used to a kingsize bed at home! I rang Reception to ask for a change of room and the lady said that they did have larger rooms but all the beds were the same size - so we decided to stay put. The bed itself was comfortable and we both slept reasonably well considering we only had room to lie still on our sides! The room was clean and modern, and the bathroom was nice, so no complaints there. It was just the size that was an issue, there was nowhere to store anything, and there was about 6 inches between the bed and the wall that you had to squeeze through to get to the bathroom! For a single room it would have been fine - for 1 person, but as a double room you feel you are being conned. The breakfast was fine and the reception staff were friendly and helpful, the internet in reception was fine, we used it to book a trip on the London Eye which was well worth doing as well. I you can get a better sized room then I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: JennersWales
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at Victoria Station and did struggle to find the hotel but once located, we could not have been happier. The bedrooms and rest of the hotel looked to have been decorated and the whole hotel was very clean indeed. Breakfast was lovely and service excellent, we also left our luggage in the hotel after checking out as we were going shopping before returning home. Would def stay there again and it's in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: WillieBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sidney on the 15th -16th Feb and 27th Feb-2nd Mar 2010. The hotel is in a terrific location, just 10 minutes walk to Victoria Station, and the 51 bus stop to Pimlico- Hamstead Heath is right outside the hotel. This bus takes you right past most of the tourist attractions e.g. Big Ben, Whitehall, Trafalgar Square, Westminster Cathedral, New Scotland Yard. It's ideal for visitors, and with an Oyster Card, quite cheap. The hotel itself, is clean, and the staff very welcoming. The rooms are quite small,but clean as is the bathroom.Located so close to the city centre, i wouldn't expect the rooms to be huge, for the price we paid.The complimentry breakfast is adequate, and filling. They will store your luggage for the day for free if necessary, and also arrange an airport transfer at a reasonable price. A good value budget hotel in an excellent location, for the tourist.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: dubliner57
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel at a very reasonable rate, so i was surprised to see the location it was in and how clean and modern it was. located right near buckingham palace in a lovely part of london and only a few minutes walk from victoria station it is ideal as you can reach any part of london from here. i would strongly advise anyone staying in london to stay here, i certainly will again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with good location!”
Reviews.Author: mikewillu
Reviews.Content: We arrived in london at victoria coach station, andf took us a good while to find the hotel, so i would definatley plan on using walkit.com to find out how to get there because its quite hard to find. Although once we arrived it was a good central location perfect for the apollo theatre and victoria tube and coach station. A 10 minute walk down the road takes you close to the tube station which gives you easy access to all areas within london. I booked this hotel as a suprise theatre trip to see wicked in the apollo, and was perfect location and excellent for what we wanted. Breakfast was included in the deal, but we didnt make it to breakfast after having a late night. Although it was a comfortable sleep and a tidy refurbised room. The hotel is modern and up to date but had to wait a good hour before our room was ready to check in which took more time off our day, but otherwise the stay went without a fault. Bus stop outside if you are travelling through london via bus, but still brilliant if travelling by tube! There is also a nice bar located in the lounge of the hotel , we didnt use it but would be tempted if staying longer.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel shame about the bathroom size”
Reviews.Author: westhammatt
Reviews.Content: me and my partner travelled to london for the night to watch a show. the hotel from the outside looks lovely . As you walk in its well furnished with a bar open till 1 am. The staff were ok and helpfull but asking for 25 quid via a credit card as a safety deposit is abit cheeky Our room was on the ground floor right near to a stair case to upper rooms so was a little bit noisey with the early risers for breakfast. The room itself was clean and tastefully decorated with a modern feel. it was slightly on the small side but you can live with that. The bathroom to be honest was tiny and when i mean tiny it really was and it was about the size of a caravans. It was right next to one side of the double bed which is also off-putting. However the hotel itself is clean and has a modern feel to it.The staff are very helpfull and will point you in the right direction wherever you need to go. Also when you check out thyey will look after your bags untill midnight which gives you the day to look around london and relax. The hotels location is near pilico underground station and has lots of restuarants , pubs and theatres nearby . However be warned the drinks prices are extreme around the area the average being £6.80 for a small white wine and a beer !!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, tiny bed, tiny bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: DavidGodf
Reviews.Content: Booked this at fairly late notice through Expedia. A "double" room was just under £100. The hotel is reasonably easy to get to from Victoria station, around a 10 minute walk. It is a converted townhouse similar to all of the other hotels in Belgrave Road. At check-in we were asked for a hard copy of the "travel agent voucher", even though check-in had our names on their system. This is so annoying and unnecessary, in the modern age of smart-phones, etc why should we have to print off hotel confirmations, hardly very environmentally friendly. We were given room 307, and told where the lift was. Naturally we assumed room 307 would be on the third floor but confusingly it is on the second floor, as we found once we got to the third floor. There is only a single lift, it is very small (a common theme in this hotel) and you end up waiting a long time for the lift at busy times. We were astonished at how tiny the room was. I have stayed in Easyhotels a few times, the room we were given was on a par with the size that Easyhotel has to offer (at half the price of the Sidney Hotel). There was an entrance way from the door to the bed that could only accommodate one person at a time, and then a bed, with a small open fronted cupboard (there would not be room to have doors on the cupboard). To get to the far side of the bed, you have to almost walk sideways between the bed and the wall. If you had any significant amount of luggage, there is absolutely no-where to store it. The bed itself barely accommodated my partner and I, and was not especially comfortable. In keeping with the apparent "theme" of the hotel, the bathroom was also very tiny, featuring toilet, small basin, and a shower cubicle. Towels were not stored in the bathroom but in the cupboard in the main room itself. To the credit of the hotel, the rooms are very clean, and do seem to have been recently re-modeled;the decoration and fittings are tasteful and appear to be high-quality and there are flat-screen TVs. A complimentary english breakfast was supplied, this was acceptable, no better and no worse. For some reason the hotel had employed a photographer to erect a camera and large tripod in the middle of the breakfast room, this rather got in the way walking to or from our table, and explanation of why he was photographing us eating our breakfast was offered. We were really disappointed in our stay. The rooms are just unacceptably tiny for a supposed four-star hotel, and there is no mention on websites such as Expedia that this will be the case. I would only ever stay in a hotel such as this if it was for single night "crash" where I checked in late and left early the next morning, there is no enjoyment to be had spending any time in the room. I really think Easyhotel offers a better deal...half the price and complete honesty about the size of their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt Get Any Better”
Reviews.Author: weneilson
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel on the 2nd and 3rd of february, We stayed in room 412 and had the most fabulous time, the staff were always so attentive and very willing to help in any matter. The facility they provide to leave your luggage untill check in time made the morning of our arrival even better as we could utilise the time we had to go and explore some of the city. Breakfast was well cooked and served with a smile. The room was imaculate and had excellent facilities. If we are ever going to london again we will be sure to stay at the sidney. 5 out of 5...

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RdP21
Reviews.Content: My friend and I visited London last summer for 4 days and enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel was located in a beautiful area lots of little cafes, restaurants and bars around. The nearest underground was a 5 min walk and there was also a bus stop right outside the hotel and the bus station was a only a 10 min walk so getting around was no problem. The staff were friendly and the hotel was very clean and welcoming. Our rooms were basic but it was clean and tidy. The only negative point would be the room size it was rather small. The shower room was tiny so if your tall or slight large you might find it a bit of a squeeze! However my friend and I were only in the hotel to sleep, wash and have breakfast so if your planning to be out most of the time sight seeing, shopping and enjoying the nightlife and looking for a basic but still decent hotel that serves breakfast I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: Jessica2010
Reviews.Content: For £139, which was advertised rate for room, one expects a certain standard that was not met by Sidney Hotel. Tiny shabby room, with no proper windows, or light, and miniscule en suite. The two other rooms I was shown were no better. This is an area well stocked with hotels and far better quality can be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sidney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray8080
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel in August 2009 for New Years Eve. We were looking forward to experiencing New Years Eve in London in what looked to be a nice hotel. Unfortunately we never got to experience the Sidney hotel because when we arrived to check in we were told that the heating in our allocated room was not working so we had been booked into another hotel of an equal standard to the Sidney. We were taken to the Victoria hotel which i think was a converted bail hostel. Totally substandard and dated. And i am being generous with that statement. Needles to say we were not going to stay in the Victoria for rest of our stay. I complained to the Sidney receptionist who appeared stuned that we did not like the Victoria. I then asked to speak to the manager. whilst we were waiting to speak to the manager there was a steady stream of people booking into the hotel including staff family and friends which made me think why is it only our room which had no heating. I then realised that the hotel may have double booked..Anyway i spoke to the manager who was very pleasent and he managed to get us into the Great Western which sounds like it come out of a cow boy film but from what ive read about the Sidney was definately a better deal. So thats our first and last experience of the Sidney and we wouldnt recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: LoveTheUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4-star hotel! 3 at a pinch. Very basic. Friendly staff. The room was the smallest room I have ever seen with no space to unpack a large suitcase. Minute but functional bathroom. Beware of the bedspreads ... the one adorning the bed hadn't been washed in weeks which for a "4-star" hotel was a disgrace. It was filthy. Suggest booking through the hotel's website to lock in an internet deal. Not worth GBP135.

Reviews.Title: “OK only if FREE internet”
Reviews.Author: h9904343
Reviews.Content: The room is much smaller than I expected, and so is the bathroom. It is difficult to move around in the room, and hardly a vacant space for my luggage. The room wall is very thin that you can clearly hear conversations from streets and other rooms. My room, however, is clean and new. The breakfast is complimentary and there are plenty of choices like bread, mushroom and egges. The location is about 5 mins walk from Pimlico tube station and it is convenient for me. You may obtain internet services from TV or your laptop, but it's charged at a rate of 1.99 pounds per hour, which is pretty expensive for a budgeted traveller. I hardly found a free-hotspot.com airstation outside to get online for free. (in which I write this review in the hotel, haha) However, given the price/performance ratio, I still believe Sidney Hotel is good to stay, but be prepared you may be isolated from internet, if you are unlucky enough.

Reviews.Title: “Negotiate Internet fees before booking”
Reviews.Author: baldogre
Reviews.Content: If you want to use the Internet in the hotel, negotiate fees before you commit. Clean, compact rooms. Very rude service. More about the Internet charges. In many hotels in the neighbourhood, internet is free. From the Sidney Hotel website, I thought it would be here too. No. Slow, unreliable, and very expensive (£2.75, for an “hour”, but they did not tell me that if I only used a minute and then logged off, I would be charged for the full hour. When I found out, I took a week of internet for £25.). When I complained about an interruption of service and a period of very slow performance, the remedies were slow in coming. When I asked for a reduction of the fee, I was refused. At breakfast (7:30 to 9) they opened punctually. For eight straight days I was asked my room number as I entered the breakfast room, then commanded brusquely to sit in a place chosen by one of the staff. On the ninth day, the person remembered my room number. They frequently stocked out of ham and toast. Several times the coffee pourer did not arrive at my table until I had finished eating. Once I went to the pourer and requested service. She did not understand, or ignored me. Meanwhile, staff was folding serviettes. One Saturday, there was a half-hour queue for breakfast at 8:30. That evening, the TV screen over the bed had a curt message reprimanding customers for not getting to breakfast earlier. Incredible but consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation and facilities for the price”
Reviews.Author: Keeno1965
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site I was really anxious and visited the hotel whilst working in London. It looked perfectly clean and I asked to see one of the rooms, which was no problem to the staff. When we arrived we were given a family room which was very clean, plenty big enough for the three of us with all the facilities you expect from a city centre hotel. The breakfast was fine and the staff friendly pleasant and helpful. I travel a lot with work and wouldn't hesitate staying in this hotel for either work or pleasure. In terms of location it is a about a 5-10 minute walk from Victoria and we came back late at night and did not feel threatened at all. There is a lovely Italian restaurant just over the road which has genuine Italian food at a very reasonable price. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smart way to spend money for a hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: JanBZ
Reviews.Content: I had some doubts before coming at the hotel , but for the price , neighbourhood, staff, quiet , breakfast and cleaning of the room , I really advice everybody to come at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about the Sidney Hotel was it was very clean”
Reviews.Author: PerthJanetmc
Reviews.Content: We had a family room for 5 nights. When we arrived our room had been cancelled due to them trying to take money on our credidt card and getting a refusal Ours had been an internet booking and the girl behind reception explained that they had sent us an e-mail and when we had not replied they cancelled the booking. We had been on holiday in England for 2 weeks already and had not checked the internet since we lrft Australia.. I was not surprised at this after reading all the reviews on triop adviser ,i was just wishing we had splashed out on a better hotel. I could see that our two boys were looking a bit worried. .The end result was that they booked us in at the hotel next door for one night and then back to the Sidney for 4 nights in the family room that we had booked. The room at the Sidney was clean and modern but once we had got our luggage in there was no room,we had to take turns in standing up. I had booked the Sidney as they offered a cooked breakfast but you got the feeling that the food was rashioned and was the same every day.We also had to wait for a table ,our boys missed breafast a couple of times as it ended at 9.00am. If we ever go to London again it will be in a better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this was a small room!”
Reviews.Author: baglady62
Reviews.Content: I've never seen a room this small before. Two pieces of luggage and two adults do not fit! On top of that the bathroom was unbelievable. First, you had to step up about 6-8 inches into it, then, think airline bathroom, add a shower you can't move in and you've got it! I could touch the sides of the bathroom with my elbows. There was a "business center" if you consider the one computer. The staff was less than friendly. No one smile. Do yourself a favor and pass on this hotel. You really get what you pay for with this one. It's less than no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Need a Sense of Humour”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaCathy
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't what we were expecting for our 3 night stay. We paid $AU142.79 per night which included a full breakfast. Other travellers had talked about tiny bathrooms, but we had a tiny bedroom and tiny bathroom. We had a double bed, a desk, a chair, a small open cupboard and not much else. We had great difficulty fitting our suitcases into the room. We had about 15 inches between the bed and the window, about 12 inches between the foot of the bed and the wall, about 6 inches between the cupboard and the bed (we had to go through sideways) and with our suitcases in the room couldn't open the bathroom door fully or the door from outside fully. When one of us wanted to come out of the bathroom, we would yell a warning and the other person had to go into the hallway to avoid being clobbered by the door. We did a lot of laughing. Apart from this, the hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff were reasonably helpful except for one lady who spoke the worst English we had encountered on the whole of our 3 month trip around Scandinavia, Russia, Eastern Europe, Ireland, etc. The location was great, easy walking distance to everything, such as Buckingham Palace, the underground, theatres. The breakfasts were excellent, but best to get there early or you have to queue, as tables limited. Very friendly service at breakfast. Our room was on the main road, but the noise didn't really bother us. The bathroom was clean and well stocked. It was small, but no smaller than a bathroom on a ship. At least we had a lift so didn't have to walk up stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the WORST hotel I've ever stayed at. Completely misrepresented!”
Reviews.Author: MrC2
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start? We arrived pretty late and had no options to go anywhere else since everything was booked in the area. I guess I'll just start listing this hotel's details: 1) Hotel listed as a 4-star....what a joke! This is a 1-star. I'm seriously not kidding. 2) Rude staff from the moment we walked in the door to when we left as early as possible the next morning. 3) Smelly and dirty everywhere, but much worse once you leave the lobby 4) TINY everything: lobby, elevator, hallways, rooms 5) No a/c or ventilation of any sort 6) Our room: broken window glass, wires hanging out of wall, mold stains on wall and ceiling, filthy floor, phone, table, blankets, and pillows, hair on bed and pillows, green corroded electric water heater (for tea) 7) Advertising photos were taken with a special lens to make it appear larger than it is.
